Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • Player
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Dealer

    public class Player
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a player in the game of blackjack

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Player(DeckOfCards thedeck)
      Creates a player

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getLosses()
      Returns the number of losses received by the player since the start of the game
      int getScore()
      Returns the current score of the player's hand
      java.lang.String getStats()
      Returns a string containing the statistics (wins, losses, ties) for the player.
      int getTies()
      Returns the number of ties received by the player since the start of the game
      int getWins()
      Returns the number of wins earned by the player
      boolean hasBlackJack()
      Returns whether or not the player has blackjack with the current hand
      boolean hasBusted()
      Returns whether or not the player has busted with the current hand
      void incLosses()
      Increments the number of losses earned by this player
      void incTies()
      Increments the number of ties earned by this player
      void incWins()
      Increments the number of wins earned by this player
      void resetStats()
      Resets the statistics for this player, setting the numbers of wins, ties, and losses to 0.
      void shuffle()
      Shuffles the deck used by this player
      protected void takeACard()
      Adds one card to the player's current hand.
      void takeFirstTwoCards()
      Deals the first two cards to the player
      void takeTurn()
      Takes the player's turn.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the player's hand

        Deals the first two cards to the player

      • takeACard

        protected void takeACard()
        Adds one card to the player's current hand. This method is used primarily by any child classes that might override takeTurn.

      • takeTurn

        public void takeTurn()
        Takes the player's turn. Specifically, it shows the human player his/her current hand and asks whether the player wants to hit or stand. The player will take cards until stand is chosen or the player's hand busts (exceeds 21). Each time a card is added, the hand and score are displayed to the player.

      • incWins

        public void incWins()
        Increments the number of wins earned by this player

      • incTies

        public void incTies()
        Increments the number of ties earned by this player

      • incLosses

        public void incLosses()
        Increments the number of losses earned by this player

      • resetStats

        public void resetStats()
        Resets the statistics for this player, setting the numbers of wins, ties, and losses to 0.

      • getStats

        public java.lang.String getStats()
        Returns a string containing the statistics (wins, losses, ties) for the player.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string representation of the player's hand
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
